intro: Calcearia compta, commonly known as the small-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to store water in its native environment. Calcearia compta is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
